comments:
Build: Callisto RC1

Hi which TPTP driver are you using?
and can u attach your workspace or steps to reproduce the problem?

> Hi which TPTP driver are you using?

As I said above, I'm using Callisto RC1

> and can u attach your workspace or steps to reproduce the problem?

Steps:

1) Create a simple "Hello World" program
2) Right click, Profile As > Java Application
3) In the Monitor tab, select "Execution Time Analysis"
4) Click Edit Options, and select "Collect method CPU time information"
5) Click Finish. Click Profile
6) Switch to "Profiling and Logging perspective"
7) Click on the result in the "Profile Monitor" view.

-> The error appears in the log

John, the short answer is that the action in the toolbar has a link to the command org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.control.item, but that command is not defined.  It's actually just a log, not a real exception.  In this case, ActionContributionItem.isVisible() will return the state for just the IAction, not it's matching command.

Does the plugin registry have an entry for org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.control.item in the org.eclipse.ui.commands extension point?  Is it defined in XML?

org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.control.provider.ControlUtility.addContributedItems(ControlUtility.java:93) is doing something and then calling update on the toolbar manager (presumably from  PDProjectExplorer).

Later,
PW

Ali, Please take a look at the problem that is happening in the ControlItem settings.

Fix in cvs.  I was abusing the action definition id of a contributed item
